item.name: Ab in die Tonne
item.comment: Cute components but lame scoring mechanism. Would have liked to see it use something akin to Gulo Gulo's race system. Can't see any replay value in this game.

item.name: Ace of Aces: Handy Rotary Series
Advanced Squad Leader: Starter Kit #2
item.comment:
Absolutely awful in terms of ability to play out of the box. The instructions don't even begin to cover how the game actually runs.
Nobody ever seems to deduct points from the perfect information factor of this game. In what situation does each side know exactly who they're fighting as well as their exact positions?

item.name: Adventure Time Card Wars: Finn vs. Jake
Amun-Re
item.comment:
Absolutely brilliant, probably Knizia's last great game. Terrific auction system and variable property values between the first and second halves really makes this interesting.
Unfortunately only good with five.

item.name: Arkadia
item.comment: After five games we'd played this out. Not a lot of meat on these bones. Sad to see Rudiger Dorn put his name on this one.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion
item.comment:
I had the first edition of this expansion and was not a huge fan of it.
Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Dunwich Horror Expansion
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Innsmouth Horror Expansion
item.comment:
My favourite AH expansion. The Deep Ones Rising track really takes away that safe feeling you get once you start sealing gates. All of a sudden you have to build up clues and Elder Signs and then rush to seal all six as soon as possible.
Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Kingsport Horror Expansion
item.comment:
Not a huge fan of this expansion. First of all, each Mythos Phase has the new overhead of adding the monster movement token. The rifts barely ever happen unless you devote the minimum of attention to having encounters at the Kingsport locations. Also, there are never any gates there, so the only reason to go is to prevents rifts from opening. Maybe half the games we play involve some sense of urgency about that.
Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Miskatonic Horror Expansion
item.comment: I still don't know what to make of this expansion. I've tried to use a bunch of the parts but they haven't made much of a difference.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The Black Goat of the Woods Expansion
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The King in Yellow Expansion
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The Lurker at the Threshold Expansion
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: AttrAction
item.comment: Fun, but not a board game.

item.name: Barony
item.comment: I feel like I've done this all before. Had a lot more fun with Tempus where you can develop your actions to be more efficient.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
Bohnanza
item.comment: Donated to game club.

item.name: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game
item.comment:
Not a whole lot of game here. I do enjoy quickly playing through the only fun part of Dungeon Lords though.
Good for two or three plays, then dump it.

item.name: But Wait, There's More!
item.comment: As bad as Snake Oil.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Castle
item.comment: I actually really liked this game and I'm not sure why I sold it.

item.name: Castles of Mad King Ludwig
item.comment: Ewww. Takes what little fun there was in Suburbia and tangles it up with variable tile sizes (which adds very little to the game) and a time-consuming reordering every turn (which adds some strategy at great cost). And the production values... awful! The graphics look like they were designed with Home Designer 1995 software and everything is so cheap and thin. SKIP!

item.name: Cathedral
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: China Rails
item.comment: Fails on every count. East-West strategy dominates, and it's obvious after the first play!

item.name: Coconuts
item.comment: Fun toy but not a board game. Novelty wears off quickly. Just go outside and play some fucking catch.

item.name: Codenames
item.comment: Boring to sit around and wait for someone to come up with something clever.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #1 – Greece & Eastern Kingdoms
Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #2 – Rome and the Barbarians
Commands & Colors: Napoleonics
item.comment: So dull. Please stop making these watered-down C&C games.

item.name: Concept
item.comment: Fun activity + scoring != game, but I enjoy it anyway.

item.name: Coup
item.comment: Nearly perfect!

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
item.comment:
Could it be? A zombie game that doesn't suck? YES.
I like this more than Robinson Crusoe because the players are independent and have their own motives.

item.name: Deep Sea Adventure
item.comment: Nifty push-your-luck game. It's not quite as good as Can't Stop! but it keeps the turns moving more quickly.

item.name: Dominion: Guilds
item.comment: The worst of the expansions that I owned, which was everything but Alchemy.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment: This game is a lot of fun.

item.name: Fauna
item.comment: Homework: Die Brettspiel.

item.name: Fighting Formations: Grossdeutschland Motorized Infantry Division
item.comment: Not all of Chad Jensen's shit turns to gold.

item.name: Forbidden Desert
item.comment: More difficult than Forbidden Island for sure.

item.name: Formula Dé Mini
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: La Granja
item.comment: The sooner would-be designers stop making games like this, the better! Overcomplicated, overwrought, and ugly as shit.

item.name: Die Händler
item.comment: Played as Die Händler and wow, was it pointless. There's no way to be certain your goods aren't going to roll around to worthless, and while this may be an "interesting decision" for the Euro elite, it wasn't for me.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
Heroscape Master Set: Swarm of the Marro
Hey! That's My Fish!
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: High Bohn Plus
item.comment: Donated to game club.

item.name: In the Shadow of the Emperor
In the Year of the Dragon
Istanbul
item.comment: A wonderful return to form by Rudiger Dorn. It's got the best parts of engine-building games but in a short timeframe. The 2-player game isn't very interactive but feels very smooth with a lot of brain-crunching to optimize movements. The 4-player game, on the other hand, is brutal, trying to avoid paying other players to land on their spot while throwing other players' family members in jail for profit.

item.name: Kingdom Builder: Nomads
item.comment: Completely unnecessary expansion.

item.name: Lancaster
item.comment: Great idea, a worker placement game in which the placements can be outbid. Unfortunately bad graphic design and artwork.

item.name: Legends of Andor
item.comment: Terrible rules, which would be okay if the game didn't suck, too. Herr Menzel should stick to illustrating!

item.name: Lord of the Rings: Friends & Foes
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
item.comment: Tight, brutal, no loose ends here. The Golden Age of Eurogames.

item.name: Manoeuvre
item.comment: Truly one of GMT's worst.

item.name: Mascarade
item.comment: Played twice with four, didn't see any planning, maybe fun with more people. Play Coup instead.

item.name: Memoir '44: Terrain Pack
item.comment: What a disappointment. The scenarios that came in the box didn't even use most of the terrain. Sorry but "build your own scenario" doesn't appeal to most gamers.

item.name: Merchants
item.comment: Only played once, with three, and it wasn't very good. I think it would be a lot better with four, or even five players.

item.name: Modern Art
item.comment: Donated to game club.

item.name: O Zoo le Mio
item.comment: The bidding in this game ruined it. Too coarse.

item.name: One Night Ultimate Werewolf
item.comment: Kind of neat. The (il)logical arguments that people throw out are interesting.

item.name: Orléans
item.comment: Turgid Euro multiplayer solitaire. Oh, at the end you get to start caring about what other people do. Briefly.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment: Initially interesting but ultimately frustrating, as its too ambitious to be playable. Character cards seems needlessly detailed as though you're about to actually play Pathfinder. Pretty sure this was designed to sell expansions, not to be fun. I must remember that Mike Selinker doesn't make good games.

item.name: Pictomania
item.comment: Slightly cumbersome scoring but there's been no better game thus far to let so few players test their drawing skills against each other.

item.name: PIX
item.comment: Absolutely awful!

item.name: Power Grid: The New Power Plant Cards
Puerto Rico: Expansion I – New Buildings
Quarriors! Rise of the Demons
item.comment: There wasn't much point to this.

item.name: Ra
item.comment:
Amazing game.
Gave it to a friend.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
The Resistance
item.comment: It's okay but the fact that some players can be completely excluded (other than voting for missions) makes Coup wayyy better.

item.name: Rialto
item.comment: No. No. No, no, no. I get it, it's a Feld. We score points here, we score points there, here a point, there a point, everywhere a point, point.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Russian Railroads
item.comment: Dry. Awful. Completely pasted-on theme. Pretends to be an engine-building game but isn't -- your actions don't become more powerful or efficient as the game DRAGS ON. Buyers of interesting games beware.

item.name: Saboteur
item.comment: Saboteur should be a case study for modern would-be designers. Rather than the long, overwrought, everthing-but-the-kitchen-sink tons-of-exclusive-miniatures Kickstarter games du jour, Saboteur demonstrates that a co-operative game with complex interactions is achievable with just a deck of cards.

item.name: Saint Petersburg
item.comment: I prefer the original St. Pete to the reprint. The new art is embarrassingly bad (even if you thought the original art didn't have its own charm) and the goods system just slows things down.

item.name: Santa Cruz
item.comment: Very cool. Played only on BSW. Let's see if this game has legs.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan Card Game
The Settlers of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
item.comment: You should not play this game with more than four players. There's a reason why the original game didn't support it.

item.name: The Siege of Alesia
item.comment: Absolute and utter shit. Typical Berg game that pushes details over gameplay. I should have known this game was garbage as soon as I punched the counters for bundles of sticks.

item.name: Skull & Roses
item.comment: Very cool bluffing game.

item.name: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Snake Oil
item.comment: Boring as shit.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
Steam Park
item.comment: Too much randomness which prevents planning. Normally I wouldn't mind but in the final round it closes too man doors.

item.name: Suburbia
item.comment: Surprisingly not a bad game from Alspach. Pity he had to put those shitty Board2Pieces characters in the game. :(

item.name: Summoner Wars: Cloaks Faction Deck
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Fallen Kingdom Faction Deck
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
Summoner Wars: Jungle Elves Faction Deck
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Master Set
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
Summoner Wars: The Filth Faction Deck
Summoner Wars: Vanguards Faction Deck
item.comment: Gave my copy to my son.

item.name: Sushi Go!
item.comment: Surprising amount of depth for such a simple game.

item.name: Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment: Yeah, yeah, I know, it's an activity, not a game, but there sure are a lot of parts to move around for not playing a game.

item.name: Techno Witches
item.comment: Several scenarios are basically broken out of the box. Apologized to the people I forced to play this with me, then sold.

item.name: Terra Mystica
item.comment: It's mostly cube-pushing but the varying race asymmetry makes it interesting. Not Top 10 material though.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Thunderstone Advance: Caverns of Bane
item.comment: Makes an interminably boring game even more painful.

item.name: Thunderstone Advance: Root of Corruption
item.comment: Please, guys, stop making games. You're just not good at it.

item.name: Thunderstone Advance: Towers of Ruin
item.comment: This is one of those games where I actually think there's something wrong with you if you like it. Played twice and NEVER AGAIN.

item.name: Tichu
item.comment: Donated to game club.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Europa 1912
item.comment: The new routes are great and really give the base game life. The warehouse thing is stupid and overcomplicates what used to be a smooth game.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
item.comment: Not too bad for a memory game but completely unnecessary and not properly developed.

item.name: Tide of Iron
item.comment: Plagued from the beginning by component issues, I never got over my negative opinion of this game. The gameplay was _okay_, not much better than Memoir '44, and fell far too short of Combat Commander. No reason to keep this when Combat Commander does so much more.

item.name: Time's Up!
item.comment: Donated to game club.

item.name: Time's Up! Title Recall!
item.comment: Donated to game club.

item.name: TransAmerica
item.comment: Donated to game club.

item.name: Uncharted: The Board Game
item.comment: Surprisingly good for a licensed game. Even the co-op survival game is tense and interesting.

item.name: The Voyages of Marco Polo
item.comment: Charming and clever. Love the differences between your explorer.

item.name: War of the Ring: Battles of the Third Age
We Didn't Playtest This: Legacies
item.comment: Not half bad.

item.name: Wilderness War
item.comment: This game plays more like an essay than anything else. Tried numerous plays to discover the fun but we were unsuccessful. Sold.

item.name: Wings of War: Watch Your Back!
Wiz-War (eighth edition)
item.comment: Turfed this one pretty quick. Not a design that needed to be refreshed for the new millenium.

item.name: Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #1
Містеріум
item.comment: Way overrated. The first game will certainly be impressive and then you realize there's not much to it.
